description: Adds the specified outbound (egress) rules to a security group.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Outbound rules can be adjusted to send traffic to specific external destinations, which may allow attackers to capture or monitor network traffic for sensitive information.
Attackers can use specific egress rules to allow communication over commonly used application layer protocols.
Attackers can set up egress rules to exfiltrate staged data through approved channels.
By setting egress rules, attackers can allow outbound traffic for remote desktop connections, facilitating lateral movement.
Attackers might configure rules to allow exfiltration using non-standard protocols.
By authorizing specific outbound ports, attackers can use non-standard ports for communication to evade defenses.
Attackers can use egress rules to bridge network boundaries, aiding lateral movement or exfiltration

securityImplications: Attackers might use AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress to allow exfiltration.
